moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Qxd5 3. Nc3 Qe5+ 4. Be2: Pretty standard till here. The white move is a waste of tempo.
moves.8... Nd7: I don't have to think too much: my developement is almost fixed in any line.
moves.9. Bd3 Bg6 10. b4: White chooses to attack earky. Ok.
moves.10... a6 11. Bb2 Ngf6 12. Bc4 Bd6: One from castling. Black has to be careful about sacs in e6.
moves.13... O-O: I normally castle queenside, but this time the mobilization of the king's pawns seems very far.
moves.15... Nb6: Maybe Nd5 at once would have been wise, blocking the pawn.
moves.19... Bxg3: Bye Bye, beloved dsb, but g3 for the queen is too tempting.
moves.20. fxg3 Qxg3 21. Rb3: Preventing Nc3, and x-raying the queen with the rook.
moves.24. Ne5 Qh4: Now a funny game begins, since black queen is due to the protection of the knight...
I am fearing a stalled game, due to the knight, so I tried to break the drawish position.
moves.30. Nxd2 Nf2+ 31. Kg1 Ng4: I have two healthy pawns, though...
moves.32. Rg3 Nf6 33. c3 a5 34. Bb1 axb4: It is a nice endgame to win., but my opponent blundered.
moves.35. Bxf5 exf5 36. axb4: ...here. A pity. But the game was won, anyway.
